name: Philomena Begley
description: '''Philomena Begley''' (born 20 October 1942) is a [[country music]] singer from [[Northern Ireland]], widely regarded as "Ireland’s Queen of Country". She rose to prominence in 1975 with her chart-topping version of "[[Blanket on the Ground]]", which outsold [[Billie Jo Spears]]’ original in Ireland. Over the course of her career, Begley has toured internationally, recorded numerous duets with [[Ray Lynam]], and performed at venues including the [[Grand Ole Opry]] and [[Carnegie Hall]]. In 2020, she became the first recipient inducted into the ICMA Hall of Fame.
